sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"提出，提供"之意。
means: offer ： 最普通用词，多指主动提出或提供意见或东西等，但是否接受由对方自行决定。
present ： 既可指提出意见建议等，又可指拿出某物供人欣赏或赠送。
propose ： 指直接而主动地提出问题或建议等，也指在讨论或争辨中提出具体意见或建议。
volunteer与offer同义，侧重出于自愿，而不是寿命做某事。

word_mean: 志愿者为了获得准确的结果，选择志愿参加者作研究对象，通常志愿者的代表性较差，因此获得的结果不能全部推论到目标人群。

sentence.Network_en: Finding a volunteer to write the computer program isn't a problem.
sentence.Network_cn: 找个志愿者编这个计算机程序不成问题。

sentence.Network_en: She was a volunteer, she hadn't had to be press-ganged.
sentence.Network_cn: 她是一个志愿者，不一定非是受人迫使的。

sentence.Network_en: I will volunteer my daughters for helping the church sale.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会使自己的女儿自愿帮助教堂出售东西.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 志愿者（volunteer）一词来源于拉丁文中的“voluntas”,意为“意愿”。对于这一概念，我国大陆和港台地区由于对volunteer的译法不一致 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as a noun, with military reference): from French volontaire 'voluntary'. The change in the ending was due to association with -eer

encyclopedia.content: 形容词a. 1.普通的；常见的 Smith is a very commonlast name in England. 在英国史密斯是很常见的姓。 2.一般的，平常的[Z][B] 3.共同的，共有的[Z][(+to)] Commoninterests bind us together. 共同的利益使我们结合在一起。 4.公共的，公众的[Z] We must all work for the commongood. 我们大家必须为公共的利益而工作。 5.粗鄙的，低级的 6.【数】共通的[Z][B] 名词n. 1.公共用地，公有地[C] common 1.共同的；公共的； 普通的

entry.tran: 志愿者;义务工作者;义工
entry.def: A volunteer is someone who does work without being paid for it, because they want to do it.

example.ex: She now helps in a local school as a volunteer three days a week...
example.tran: 目前她在当地的一家学校做志愿工作，一周去3天。

example.ex: Mike was a member of the local volunteer fire brigade.
example.tran: 迈克是当地消防队的一名志愿消防员。

entry.tran: 自告奋勇者;主动做事者
entry.def: A volunteer is someone who offers to do a particular task or job without being forced to do it.

example.ex: Right. What I want now is two volunteers to come down to the front...
example.tran: 好了，现在我需要两个自告奋勇的人到前面来。

entry.def: If you volunteer to do something, you offer to do it without being forced to do it.

example.ex: Aunt Mary volunteered to clean up the kitchen...
example.tran: 玛丽阿姨主动要求清扫厨房。

example.ex: He volunteered for the army in 1939...

entry.def: If you volunteer information, you tell someone something without being asked.

example.ex: The room was quiet; no one volunteered any further information...
example.tran: 房间很安静，无人主动提供更多的信息。

example.ex: 'They  were both great supporters of Franco,' Ryle volunteered...
example.tran: “他们都是佛朗哥的忠实支持者，”赖尔主动说道。

entry.def: A volunteer is someone who chooses to join the armed forces, especially during a war, as opposed to someone who is forced to join by law.

example.ex: They fought as volunteers with the Afghan guerrillas...
example.tran: 他们作为志愿军和阿富汗的游击队员并肩作战。

example.ex: Victory in the civil war had been achieved by a mainly volunteer army.
example.tran: 一支主要由志愿军组成的队伍取得了内战的胜利。

means.word_mean: 1. (military) a person who freely enlists for service
2. a person who performs voluntary work

sentences.sentence: "She volunteered to drive the old lady home"
"I offered to help with the dishes but the hostess would not hear of it"
"the soup kitchen was run primarily by unpaid helpers"

auth_sentence.content: We have our policy set by our all-volunteer board.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have our policy set by our all-volunteer board.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have our policy set by our all-volunteer board.

auth_sentence.content: These judges did not volunteer to monitor the elections.
auth_sentence.res_content: These judges did not volunteer to monitor the elections.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: These judges did not volunteer to monitor the elections.

auth_sentence.content: This is where I volunteer my time and energy.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is where I volunteer my time and energy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is where I volunteer my time and energy.

stems_affixes.word_buile: volunt意志,意愿+ary……的→adj.自愿的,志愿的
volunt=vol意志,意愿+eer人→意愿的人→志愿者
mountain山+eer……人员→n.山地人 v.爬山
profit利润+eer……人员→v.牟取暴利;囤积居奇 n.奸商,牟取暴利者
volunt意志+eer人→意愿的人→志愿者
mountain山+eer……人员→n.山地人 v.爬山
profit利润+eer……人员→v.牟取暴利;囤积居奇 n.奸商,牟取暴利者

kd.ZH: 自愿地给予或提供帮助

Sentence.sentence: Each member volunteered to clean up and to dig in plot, five flats of flowers.
If Barbara feels the need to do socially important work, he thinks that she should do volunteer work one or two days a week.
Barbara, on the other hand, has missed the excitement of her profession and does not feel she would be satisfied doing volunteer work

If you tell an acquaintance you are a grandfather who recently lost his wife and who does volunteer work on weekends, several elements of your self-image are bought to light — the roles of grandparent, widower and conscientious citizen.

means.word_mean: 自动提供, 自愿效劳

sentences.cn: 他们当中有多少人愿意自愿效劳?

sentences.en: My friend volunteered an interesting piece of news.
sentences.cn: 我的朋友自动说了一则有趣的消息。

sentences.en: He volunteered to water our plants.
sentences.cn: 他自告奋勇给我们的树木浇水。

jushi.english: As soon as the war was declared, many men volunteered.
jushi.chinese: 一经宣布战争事项,就有很多人报名参军。
他们当中有多少人是自愿效劳的?

jushi.english: Many people volunteered in the undertaking.
jushi.chinese: 很多人自动来参加这项工作。
